revised_title: Improving the Definition and Measurement of Toxicity in Biological Experiments
tldr: The author discusses the challenges in determining the toxicity of drugs and poisons, emphasizing the need for a more accurate definition of terms like "minimal lethal dose." They propose using the median lethal dose (LD50) as a standard measure of toxicity and introduce the LD50 symbol to represent this value. The author also highlights the importance of using large numbers of animals in biological experiments to obtain accurate results.
